Posts.Content: May 5, 2017 08:17AM Katiew321 wrote: I think I'll phone in the morning then. She said it would take 6-8 weeks for everything to feel normal again so wasn't sure if I was just being paranoid or not so was wondering If anyone else had experienced a similar thing
Posts.Title: Pain a month after surgery.. is this normal? Katiew321 Katiew321

Posts.Content: Katiew321 wrote: Hi everyone, I had a benign breast tumour removed almost 5 weeks ago and after the surgery I felt fine with no pain! However, a few days ago when the last of my stitches came out my breast is now feeling quite sore and as if there is a lump there where the tumour was. I was just wondering if this was normal or not? Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Pain a month after surgery.. is this normal? Katiew321 Katiew321

Posts.Content: May 5, 2017 08:06AM - edited May 5, 2017 08:07AM by Katiew321 I've read that it's common to get lumps after surgery, I just didn't want to phone/go back to the hospital if it was something that is normal
Posts.Title: Pain a month after surgery.. is this normal? Katiew321 Katiew321

Posts.Content: May 5, 2017 08:40AM - edited May 5, 2017 08:41AM by Katiew321 I saw my surgeon 2 weeks ago and everything was healing well, my stitches are dissolvable so haven't had to go back since. I've read on many online articles that a lot of people experience lumps after surgery, my surgeon also told me this. I wanted to post first before calling my doctor incase anyone had experienced this or if it was normal :)
